Amazing experience…staff good ,Rooms neat & clean ,hygienic food
Nice little swimming pool for recreation
love to come back again
Superb service provide by your team... Really superb efforts by team... One of most precious place to stay in jaipur... Must visit

After going through a lot of reviews on Maps for various hotels which were fake but not this hotel. We really enjoyed the experience here and were well received. The hotel was very clean and our room even had a big bath tub. The staff here were very helpful and kind. This place is excellent for travellers with family. They also have a small pool for children at the entrance and the top floor has a great restaurant as well.

It's a good place to stay in Jaipur as everything is near to this place and also one can experience local trends of jaipur.
Hotel has good roof top resturant, good stay for the amount of money that they charge if booked online. The staff and the owner are very helping and nice.

The Maurvi Inn in Jaipur is a solid choice for anyone looking for a comfortable place to stay. The hotel offers good service and a pleasant environment. It's conveniently located and provides everything you need for a relaxing stay. Overall, it's a reliable option for those visiting Jaipur.

Best experience at The Maurvi Inn. Restaurant and Room Service is Excellent. One of the best stay in Jaipur. I would highly recommend this hotel. Owner's and Staff behaviour was pleasent. We make some beautiful memories here. Thank you to Owner, manager and team.
Worst rooms ever seen, behaviour of owner is very rude and pathetic, all good reviews are paid or post by own.not worth it and don’t book without checking
Very good hotel my good experience in this hotel room was very good & neat and clean hotel staff behaviour was very good hotel staff was very helpful overall my good experience 👍👍

"Great location, beautiful surroundings, fantastic staff. Most friendly and helpful receptionist and staff, first impression of the hotel was very good and wonderful."
"The rooms were clean and very comfortable, and the decor was lovely."
"Great stay, service and facilities are excellent."
"I loved everything about this hotel."
"I would highly recommend (hotel name) as the rooms are clean and comfortable, the facilities are top notch and the staff is attentive.

Had one of the worst experience in my life.The hotel is extremely dirty and poorly managed. The hotel seriously need evaluate option for improving general cleanliness. Staff are terrible... I went with family and they have no consideration... Rooms are worst quality rooms was dust central, dust had settled everywhere. Staff were unhelpful and indifferent. Bathroom  persistent sewage smell . For anything you ask them they say " Sorry sir hamare yaha ye nahi milta".
In one word I would say it was a pathetic experience . Please don't stay here totally west of money.

I and my friend stayed in this hotel for two days. The rooms of this hotel are clean and have good space and the bathroom and toilet are also clean and the nature of the owner of this hotel is friendly, humble and good. The hotel owner suggested us the best places to visit in Jaipur and we ordered food online at night but the hotel gates were closed, so on calling the owner, he opened the gate at midnight without any hesitation.

Rooms and ambiance is good but we booked earlier two rooms and reached before on time but they provided  a 4 persons single bedroom and that was using by some one,we  entered the room then only came to knew this,bed sheets and pillows are used and someone suitcase belonging are inside suddenly we went out ,in my family my mother having aged 80+ and kids all are suffered lots ,the receptionist says no single rooms and what we booked given to someone because our rent is less he said I am getting 3500 per room why should I give you even though we booked earlier so bad experience

Hey, I recently visited this hotel. My experience was very good. The rooms of the hotel were quite clean and nice. Whenever you come to Jaipur, I definitely visit this hotel once. I hope you will like it. Thank you so much.

I stayed at goSTOPS Jaipur for 2 days and had a nice experience overall. It's set up like a dormitory and is a great option for solo travelers like me. The place was clean, well-maintained, and had a good vibe. Everything from the rooms to the washrooms felt fresh and tidy, which I really appreciated.
The common areas are great for meeting new people or just relaxing. However, I did find the food a bit on the expensive side compared to local options nearby.
Overall, it’s a comfortable and budget-friendly place to stay if you're traveling alone or with friends, and want a chill, hostel-like atmosphere.

I booked a personal room for my trip after checking the pictures at booking.com but apparently they are old pics and now their rooms are in bizarre shape and they are doing a scam.
They refused my refunds and they refused any other room option as they were sold out.
Please check the pics of the reality vs dhokhaa.

This was my third stay at this, and every time, it's been an amazing experience. Whenever I travel to Jaipur, this is my go-to place because the environment is so calm and relaxing.

The food here is absolutely delicious! Once you order something, you feel like ordering it again—it’s that good. The service is quick, and they maintain great quality.

The only thing that felt a bit inconvenient was that they don’t accept cash for food orders. It would be great if they added that as an option. But apart from that, everything was top-notch. Definitely staying here again next time!

*Warning About This Accommodation*
I'd like to share my experience with this place. Be cautious of the Google photos, as they might not accurately represent the actual conditions.

*Issues I Faced*
- *Suffocating playing area*: The playing area was poorly ventilated and had a strong smell.
- *Cleanliness issues*: While our 6-bed mixed dormitory room was decent, other areas of the place were not clean.
- *Other rooms*: We noticed that some of the other rooms, like the 8-bed dormitories, were not maintained as well.

I recently stayed at Gostops Jaipur in March, and I can honestly say it was one of the worst experiences I’ve ever had at a hostel. I’ve stayed at other Gostops locations in Udaipur, Goa, and Mumbai, and never encountered anything close to this level of disappointment.

First, the Wi-Fi was completely non-functional during my entire stay, which is unacceptable, especially for a place that markets itself as a modern, convenient option for travelers. It made it impossible to do anything that required an internet connection.

To make matters worse, my friend fell ill, and we needed urgent help to get some medicine from a nearby chemist around 11-12 pm. We approached the staff for assistance, but there was no support or concern shown for our situation. We were left to fend for ourselves in a distressing situation with no empathy or care from the hotel staff.

The most shocking part of our stay, however, was the condition of the room. It was absolutely disgusting. The cleanliness was appalling, and it made our stay unbearable. I’ve stayed in multiple Gostops locations before, and I’ve never experienced such poor standards.

I expected much better from a brand I’ve trusted in the past. I will not be returning to Gostops Jaipur and cannot recommend this location to anyone. This experience has been completely unacceptable, and I sincerely hope the management takes immediate action to address these issues.

Worst hotel one could ever stay in
1. We tried calling them to ask for early checkin, firstly they didn’t pick call and then the number wasn’t reachable. So we reached hotel directly where they charged 300₹ for 3hrs Even though it was mentioned on Goibobo booking that complimentary early checkin.
2. Firstly they’ve given a key of the room where someone was already staying. Upon opening the door I saw the luggage. Luckily people were not there in the room at that time (breach of privacy)
3. Then they’ve given another room key where the room was too smelly and dampness all over the walls.
4. The tube light & AC of the room was also not working. Also it doesn’t have a TV. Upon complaining they changed the room.
5. In third room finally we stayed. In this room also there was dampness. There was no water for half a day in washroom.
6. There was a big layer of dust in table and bed.
7. They used to turn off the AC from reception multiple times a day and turn it on only when we call them or visit reception.
8. Multiple times when we asked for RO water their worker said RO is not working and we need to purchase packaged water When I asked manager he said there is no problem with RO and he sent the water later on.
9. For our 3days of stay no one came for room cleaning and even the plates of the food we ordered remain in the passage as they didn’t picked it up from there as well.
10. The window of the room was broken and hot air was coming from there constantly. We were in fear what if a bird comes in.
11. Many of the switches of the rooms were either not working or broken.
12. Room lock wasn’t working when tried to lock from outside. Every time we go out we need to spent 10-15mins to lock the door.
13. On last day someone tried to open our door from outside multiple times early in the morning. It’s good that we used the latch on door. It’s a big safety concern.
14. Most of the time they do not pick the call on reception and the given mobile number also remains busy.
15. The wifi of the hotel was too slow to connect and even watch videos. We had to connect laptop to the mobile hotspot to work.

The hotel is nice with a city view. Food here is good. Transportation is easily available. Room service is a bit slow, though some staff are good and cooperative but some are not nice. Affordable rate so not so luxury but good spot for friends for a seamless weekend.

I recently stayed at Laxmi Villa Palace near Jaipur railway station and unfortunately, the experience was far from satisfactory. We booked this room in advance based on online pictures that advertised it as a deluxe room, but the reality was disappointing. The hotel's condition was poor, with dirty walls and an unclean washroom that failed to meet basic hygiene standards. The bathroom drain, as seen in the photos, was grimy and worn, while the electrical outlet showed signs of dust and neglect. Despite requesting cleaning and service, the staff did not respond adequately, reflecting a lack of proper maintenance and customer care. I would not recommend this hotel to others due to its subpar conditions and unhelpful service. Additionally, I advise against renting a room based solely on online pictures—please visit and check the room in person before booking.

Rooms were not in good condition. Service was not good at all we called them for several time but they didn't pick. Price were high according to rooms and service. Neither tv working properly nor ACs of our rooms ... On our recommendation kindly don't visit here . Really worst experience ever.😑

Disappointing stay at Hotel Laxmi Villa Palace booked via MakeMyTrip. Promised facilities like a working TV, Telephone, Towels and Toiletries were unavailable, and the "complimentary breakfast" was limited to a tea and one basic item, with extra charges for anything else. Misleading listing and poor service. I Won't recommend it at all.

Our room was so filthy we were all worried we would get bed bugs. Bedding was stained on arrival so asked them for new bedding which was slightly cleaner but smelt like the interior of a damp cupboard. Toilet didn’t flush in either of the rooms we booked and both fridges were mouldy. Bathrooms felt dirty. Rooms looked nothing like the photos. Location is central enough but not super convenient - however I would be fine with it if the rooms were clean. The ant colony who lived in one of the rooms were friendly at least and the staff were nice. I think a lot of the 5 star reviews on here are fake.

One of the best property in Jaipur for a pocket friendly stay. The rooms are comfortable and stylish and will give you the Rajasthani vibes. The staff is generous and helpful and the rooms are super clean. Do plan your stay
Soo much beautiful room with amazing view the best thing its the middle of city. You can go anywhere so easy. And so friendly staff also

The location of the hotel is right in the middle of the market, with not at all clean roads and littered everywhere. The reachability to the tourist places is very near from the hotel, but we did not feel comfortable staying in the property due to shady surrounding, and empty reception. The rooms are big, spacious and clean if you are looking for a budget trip.

Very good location friendly staff neat and clean room my stay very good free Wi-Fi 24 hour hot water in Room all monuments near walking distance hawa Mahal jantar mantar City palace Govind Dev Ji temple and main market Bapu bazar etc
Good place to stay. To reach the Hotel it is easily accessible. Room service is also okay okay. Can have better service. Also the food may he better at that price range. Overall nice experience.

A very nice hotel with excellent staff service. In particular, there’s a gentleman in the restaurant named Ram Avtar, who is extremely professional, polite, and dedicated. I would request the hotel management to recognize his efforts and consider hiring more staff like him.

I had a comfortable stay at Hotel Kings Corner in Rajapark Jaipur.
The rooms were clean and spacious, with all basic amenities provided.
Staff was polite, helpful, and quick to respond.
Food quality was good, and the location was convenient for travel.
Overall, a great experience and good value for money.
Good location, excellent service and staff support, rooms are a bit small but the management makes up for it with its exceptionally good service.
Location and the rooftop area was good , service provided by the staff was decent and good. Good choice for the stay if you planning for fine night dinner

❌ Worst Experience at Hotel Reeve Inn, Jaipur – Avoid at All Costs!

I checked into Hotel Reeve Inn on 8th July, and it turned out to be one of the worst hotel experiences I’ve ever had.

From the moment we arrived, it was clear that the staff had no understanding of basic hospitality. We were not even offered a single bottle of drinking water upon check-in. When we requested a place to dry our clothes, they bluntly said there’s no facility for that. Only after repeated requests and back-and-forth conversations did they grudgingly allow us to use a balcony in a room that was under renovation—hardly a proper solution.

We had also asked them to keep our luggage safely while we went for sightseeing. They agreed, but to our shock, when we returned, we found our luggage had been dumped on the floor, completely unattended, with zero security.

To make matters worse, we returned to the hotel completely drenched from rain, and not a single staff member offered us a towel or any assistance. It felt like we were completely on our own—no service, no courtesy, no care.

The entire experience left us frustrated and disappointed. This hotel lacks even the most basic sense of customer service and is clearly not interested in guest comfort or satisfaction.

⚠️ Future guests, beware! If you’re expecting a welcoming, helpful, or even mildly hospitable stay—this is NOT the place.

recently stayed at Hotel Reeve in Jaipur for a short trip. The room was quite small, which makes it more suitable for solo travelers or those staying just for a day. Initially, I noticed there was no sitting arrangement in the room, and the TV remote was missing. However, the staff was very prompt in addressing these issues, and they resolved them quickly. Overall, it's a decent option for a brief stay.

This property is nearer to railway station(1.5 kms from station). Check in was smooth and good. The rooms are very small in size and looks conjusted. There was no space to keep the luggage in the room. Towel was dirty and the blanket was kind of ok ok type. If you are solo traveller or with friends then u can consider this for a budget stay. If for family then look for some other hotels.

I stayed at room 104, quite good experience and staff was friendly. Locker room was also available. A few things can be improved, but for the current price range, it's the best in the location. They also gave a return gift 🎁

I visited in this hotel and the experience was worst.  The bed wasn't cozy & the pillows were too dirty, no housekeeping for 3 -4 days, and the blanket smell was too dirty however: I was okay with this coz I was there for outing whole day but I got disappointed while check-out, they stopped me at the reception area and send somebody to check the room and the person came and showed an oil stain on bedsheet, for this only they took extra money and shared tea & oil stain cannot be removed so you have to pay extra charges.
The first experience in jaipur was about to be the best but the check-out from this Hotel made it worst.

We went for dinner.

Service, atmosphere and drinks were all fantastic and I cannot fault this side.

However the food was actually really average. We had 3 small dishes, 2 large plates and 2 breads. There was nothing that was fantastic and 2 dishes were very poor. We had a mushroom wrapped in banana leaf and the mushrooms were very tough and you couldn't chew them. And on the garlic naan the garlic was undercooked and bitter. All other dishes were just good and not special.

Unfortunately for the price which is very high you expect the food to be special and at the minimum all edible.

For the above and 2 drinks the bill came to 6500r which is roughly the same you would pay in London so I was expecting some special food.

A true gem in hidden in the middle of Johari Bazaar! A must visit when in Jaipur! The rooms, service, cuisine, ambience and everything is done with attention to details. Can't wait to return again and again and again!

"A lovely, cozy, and aesthetic place! I really enjoyed the delicious food and the great vibes. However, the location is a bit tricky to reach, and I found the prices to be slightly on the higher side. Still, it's a nice spot to relax and unwind."
Absolutely loved the creative cocktails and cuisine - by far and away the best cocktails we had in India! Staff were also so lovely. It's a great place to rest from the hectic streets.

The Johri, Jaipur – A Hidden Gem of Timeless Luxury! ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐

I stayed at The Johri in 2021, and it was an unforgettable experience. Nestled in the heart of Jaipur, this boutique hotel is a perfect blend of heritage, elegance, and modern comfort. Every detail, from the exquisite hand-crafted decor to the serene ambiance, reflects impeccable taste and craftsmanship.

The rooms are beautifully designed, filled with natural light, rich textiles, and thoughtful details that make you feel at home. The hospitality is warm and personalized, ensuring an intimate and luxurious stay.

Dining at The Johri is a culinary delight—their carefully curated menu offers the finest flavors with a focus on fresh, locally sourced ingredients. The ambiance of the restaurant is as enchanting as the food itself.

A truly immersive luxury experience, perfect for those who appreciate heritage, design, and soul-soothing hospitality. Would return in a heartbeat! Highly recommended.

Parking for four wheeler is difficult. Overall rustic appearance is there in the rooms which gives it a charm. Rooftop restaurant is also good. After 12 pm the gate of the locality is closed so you have to take other gate.

This hotel delivers exceptional hospitality, with staff who are courteous, discerning, and unobtrusively efficient. The property is bright and well-ventilated, designed to feel both spacious and inviting. Meals are skillfully prepared, balancing robust flavors with impeccable hygiene. The rooftop restaurant, understated yet elegant, offers a serene ambiance enhanced by pleasing views. Every detail reflects considered care, making it a genuinely comfortable stay.

We had a very lovely 2 night stay. The rooms and beds are big & very comfortable. And most of all: the service was outstanding! ☺️ We had the most lovely conversation with Arvinel Rajawat, who told us all about local dishes & how to make them over breakfast. And Ibrahim helped us book a train to Udaipur.
Thank you to everyone for making out stay so comfortable 😊

PS: the breakfast food was so good! Wow

Had a comfortable stay at Nahargarh Haveli Hotel in Jaipur. The room was cozy, service was excellent, and the included breakfast was delicious. Located in a quiet residential area with very friendly staff. Plus, the railway station is just 1 km away!! An easy 10-minute walk. Highly recommended!

It was a memorable stay . Hotel MD / Manager and staff were very polite and helpful. Food was very delicious. Rooms and bathrooms were very clean.This hotel interior is extremely very beautiful. You can enjoy a real jaipur look. Our car driver also very good.

Khatu Haveli is a lovely little haven in the heart of Jaipur. This hotel has bags of character, set back off the streets of Jaipur. The hotel staff were helpful, the room clean and comfortable, and they have a rooftop with amazing views of the city. They even drove us to the train station when our Uber didn't show up. I would highly recommend!

The building is gorgeous with an excellent rooftop view. The courtyards and large bathroom were a highlight of the physical building. The breakfast was lovely with good service. Staff kindly carried our bags from our room to our taxi. Most staff was professional but we had a few incidents: they tried to book us a taxi 10x the price of an Uber to our next location, a couple staff wanted to take photos with us in our wedding clothes, and a guy at the desk was very forcefully telling us why buying wedding clothes in Delhi is so terrible.  These are not uncommon experiences across our time in North India, but I was disappointed that this happened at the hotel. I did feel safe at the gated property which is relatively quiet for being within the walls of Jaipur.

I visited the hotel Khatu Haveli with my foreign friend who had booked a room there. The staff was very rude and unprofessional. They asked me to pay for an extra bed and provide my ID, which I agreed to do, but they still treated me poorly because I am Indian. They were angry and disrespectful to me and my friend. The hotel is also located in a very congested street, which made it hard to reach by car. I was so disappointed that I decided to search for another hotel. I do not recommend anyone to stay at this place. It is not worth the money or the hassle. There are much better options in Jaipur.

Khatu Haveli is a lovely place to stay, in a busy area, but very peaceful and calm once you’re in the property. There is an old vibe and nice feel to things, a rooftop where you can enjoy conversations, the view of the fort behind you and otherwise just a good spot to observe daily life in Jaipur.

We enjoyed both breakfast and dinner cooked with much care and love, tasty food that’s typically home cooked. We were very comfortable and would love to stay here again. Many thanks to the owners as well as the staff who were all very kind and worked hard to make sure we enjoyed our stay.

Beautiful haveli in the Pink City of Jaipur. There is a lounge on the roof that offers a beautiful sunrise view over the city as well as a view of the forts on the mountain. Rooms pleasant with wifi, tv, and airconditioner. The breakfast in the morning was truly delicious. We are still thinking about their pressed rice. Wish I had more time to thoroughly enjoy their garden.

I will be coming back for sure!
The hospitality is out of this world, not to mention that the hotel itself is just beautiful. The staff is really friendly and will prepare amazing meals for you during your stay. The hotel itself is decorated very tastefully and with great attention to detail. We really felt at home here. Would definitely recommend☀️

Welcome Home!
I say welcome home  because the Singh family have seen to every last detail ti make you feel like a part of their family. I stayed for 6 days and would have stayed longer if I had been smart. I loved the quiet peace.

My room had floral medallions painted on the ceiling. The coved ceilings are tiled with glass (I think) mosaic.
The staff is kind and helpful. There are a thousand details I can’t list here which make the stay sooooo pleasant. Breakfast can be western or Indian style. I highly recommend Parata stuffed with potato paired with yoghurt and boiled eggs. Top it off with a pot of masala chai and you are ready for the day! Of course this all served poolside if you like. I watched birds and wrote each morning over a long breakfast.

My kind hosts accommodated me for a train station pick up, laundry service, and tips on what to do for Holi.

I swam in the crystal clear water of the pool many days and even stayed in for dinner a couple of times. This place is a gorgeous haven. I can’t say enough about how I loved it!
Owners are friendly and made my stay very safe and comfortable. The pool area is very relaxing. Meals served are well- prepared. Kudos team and truly recommended stay in Jaipur!

I recently stayed at this hotel in Jaipur and it was an amazing experience. The hospitality was outstanding, with staff always going the extra mile to ensure comfort. The service was prompt and efficient making the stay even more enjoyable. The rooms were clean and well maintained providing the perfect balance of comfort and style. Surrounded by lush greenery the hotel's peaceful ambience made it refreshing retreat from the city's hustle and bustle. I truly enjoyed my stay and would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Jaipur. It's a perfect place to relax and unwind.

What a gem Jas Vilas is! We were pleasantly surprised at how much we loved our stay. The owners are wonderful and so kind to their guests, as is the rest of their generous staff. We felt as though we were staying in a family home instead of a foreign hotel. The breakfast in the mornings are wonderful and plentiful, as are the dinners and lunches that are available. Everything was delicious and honestly very comfortable. We look forward to returning again!

I would like to extend my sincere appreciation for the wonderful experience at your hotel. The property was well-maintained, clean, and offered a very comfortable stay. Special thanks to the staff for their warm hospitality, professionalism, and prompt service throughout our time there.

Every team member we interacted with was courteous and helpful, always willing to go the extra mile to ensure our needs were met. Their friendly attitude truly made a difference and added a personal touch to our stay.

Looking forward to visiting again and definitely recommending your property to others.

We had a really good stay in the hotel. The room was big and nice.
We had breakfast and dinner at the restaurant of the hotel. They serve very delicious food there but it took some minutes. We had good chats with the waiter. He’s very kind and attentive.
We enjoyed the stay and dinner with you.

We lived at this Hotel for 3 days, and everything was so nice!
The staff was warm and welcoming, and did everything to give us the absolute best service.
Breakfast is nice, and you can order dinner from the hotel, if you feel like an evening in.
The rooms are good. They have aircondition and fan, and separate bathroom inside you room.
The staff asked if we needed cleaning after the first night, which we didn’t, but it was so nice of them to ask :D
We highly recommend if going to Jaipur.

We had a wonderful stay at Mahal Khandela with our family. The property has a beautiful haveli-style architecture that truly gives a heritage feel. Rooms were neat and clean, and the staff was courteous and helpful throughout our stay. The food was delicious, with authentic flavors that made every meal memorable. Overall, a perfect blend of comfort, cleanliness, and traditional charm. Highly recommended!

Very nicely done decor which gives a great vibe. The welcoming staff with their smiles make your stay very comfortable. We only had breakfast here and it was good. Overall a great place to stay with family.
I’m not sure about the location but most big name hotels are in the same vicinity so must be a good location.
Forgot to mention that we did join the owner and his friends for a karaoke session and it was wonderful. And also that we were welcomed with a traditional way.

I had a wonderful stay at this hotel. The staff were extremely welcoming, polite, and always ready to help. The rooms were clean, spacious, and well-maintained with all the necessary amenities. The food was delicious and had a good variety. Location is also very convenient, close to major attractions/transport.

Special thanks to the management and team for making my stay so comfortable. I will definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family, and I look forward to visiting again.

The services and staff of the hotel are super nice and humble.
The rooms were neat and tidy.

I checked out of the room but then by evening, my plans changed and I asked them to give me the same room and it didn't need to be tidied up. But they still squared it up to perfection.

The staff is prompt with everything.

The breakfast provided in the hotel lobby is something that you should not opt for. It wasn't great.

The place is not ideally located and sometimes you'll need extra patience to order cabs to or from the place.

I recently booked this hotel for my trainees for three days which includes breakfast and dinner. I got lots of compliments regarding service staff, food and hygiene. I strongly recommend this place for Individual and group stays. Best hotel with best service and staff.

### 🌟 Exceptional Hospitality and Unforgettable Stay at Hotel Dvij Inn, Jaipur!
**★★★★★**

From the moment I arrived at **Hotel Dvij Inn**, I was enveloped in an atmosphere of warmth and luxury. Nestled in **Gopalpura**, this 3-star gem offers a perfect blend of elegance and comfort, making it an ideal base for exploring Jaipur’s Pink City. Here’s why my experience deserves a resounding five stars:

#### 🛎️ **Impeccable Service & Staff Hospitality**
The staff here redefined **"going above and beyond."** Special shout-out to **Mr. Bhawani Singh** (Front Office Manager) attentiveness left a lasting impression. The team consistently offered **polite, prompt assistance**

#### 🛏️ **Spacious, Clean, & Comfortable Rooms**
- **Room Quality:** The **Deluxe Room** (250 sq. ft.) was spotless.
- **Cleanliness:** Housekeeping maintained **immaculate standards** daily—linens fresh, bathroom gleaming, and thoughtful touches like complimentary bottled water .
- **Ambiance:** Soundproof windows ensured peace, while the sofa and wooden flooring added a homely feel .

#### 🍽️ **Delicious Vegetarian Cuisine**
The on-site restaurant **Satvik** was a highlight! I savored:   .
- **Multi-Cuisine Lunch/Dinner:** From North Indian curries to Chinese stir-fries—all fresh
#### 💰 **Outstanding Value for Money**

Restaurant food is good and all staff member are good on e the staff member name is bantu he is very reliant.

Rooms and bathroom are very neat but draw back is if you go for extra bed they provide you a bed on floor rather than on stand.

Check full video on my YouTube channel – Know Your Stay!
We had a wonderful experience at Hotel Dev Mahal in Bani Park. The ambiance is cozy with beautiful interiors, warm lighting, and charming artwork that gives a true heritage vibe. The staff was courteous and helpful throughout our stay. Rooms were clean, spacious, and comfortable.

We loved that the restaurant is located on the second floor and serves all meals – the food was tasty and homely. The property has two floors with various room categories like Luxury, Upper Luxury, and Suite – each offering a unique feel.

If you’re looking for a peaceful boutique stay in Jaipur with a touch of tradition, Dev Mahal is a great choice.

I recently stayed at this hotel and was initially greeted by Abhishek, who came across as quiet and reserved. However, my perception quickly changed over the course of my stay. Abhishek went above and beyond to accommodate visiting family members and even helped me locate a specific type of ice cream that’s not easily available locally—thank you, Abhishek, if you happen to read this!

The rooms are charmingly styled in a rustic, cottage-like aesthetic. Washed wood furnishings paired with Jaipur textile designs give the space a warm, traditional feel.

The restaurant was a standout. Despite the understated ambiance compared to larger brand-name hotels, the food far surpassed anything recommended by Google. Don’t be fooled by appearances—this place delivers quality and flavor. I highly recommend trying it.

Mr. Saurabh brings a refreshing sense of calm to the property. Together, he and Abhishek clearly live and breathe hospitality—they are the heart of the hotel.

The only drawbacks I experienced were the location, which doesn’t quite reflect the character of the hotel, and the unreliable internet. I had to rely on my mobile hotspot for most of my work.

Overall, a heartfelt and memorable stay—made special by the people behind the scenes.

Beautiful room and great location.
The stay was both luxurious and relaxing.
Breakfast was definitely worth it.
We thoroughly enjoyed our time here!
Staff is very polite and helpful

We stayed at this hotel on a very wet time and they made us feel so welcome, offering us warm drinks when we came in wet. The room service was amazing, food was delicious. Dollar on the desk was very helpful and welcoming. Thank you for a lovely stay!

This hotel is truly amazing. It's a small boutique hotel, very beautiful, located in the center of Jaipur. The staff's service was excellent from the moment we arrived until we left. They always had a smile on their faces. They remembered each of our names and called us by them. The rooms were clean and had very beautiful designs. The breakfast had a good variety, with international flavors that weren’t too spicy.

Mr. Kanishk was very helpful and kind.

I stayed in Sugan Niwas Palace for 1 night only although my stay in Jaipur was for more days I opted to check out from this place.
It is a huge property with the ancient antique look but dirty and unkempt. The people managing the place seem to have no interest in comfort of the guests. The room smelt of dampness and curtains seemed to be dirty and dusty. Food was average.
Very basic stay at a property that has a potential of giving a valuable experience to the guests.
Overall dispointing.

- No TV in the room
- No hairdryer
- No electric kettle
- Room was on the top floor with a balcony that had a direct tank overflow water problem
- Broken shower
- Pool area lacked umbrella shades

To add to the disappointment, the menu prices were exorbitantly high.

Overall, my stay was extremely disappointing, and I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

My stay at Sugan Niwas Palace was a mix of highs and lows. The property itself is beautiful, with spacious rooms, large washrooms, and even a dressing room. However, the charm was overshadowed by poor maintenance — everything felt dusty, and the balcony was extremely dirty.

While I appreciated the early check-in, the receptionist was not particularly friendly. The AC was noisy and didn’t cool properly, and the remote had no batteries. When I requested batteries, they took the remote and never returned it.

A major concern was receiving a text in the afternoon stating my booking was canceled after I had already checked in. When I called to clarify, they admitted it was a mistake and assured me my booking was secure.

On the bright side, their food was good, and the property is well-located. The rates are reasonable, but the lack of proper maintenance and service made the experience underwhelming.

Fantastic Experience for Our Family Function at Hotel Siddharsh

If you're looking for a hotel just a stone’s throw from Jaipur International Airport, Cygnett Inn Airport is a smart pick. The location is unbeatable—just minutes from the terminal—making it ideal for late-night arrivals or early-morning flights.

The rooms are modern, clean, and well-equipped, with comfortable beds, good air conditioning, and essential amenities like a kettle, Wi-Fi, and smart TV. Everything is neat and functional, perfect for both business travelers and families.

The staff is courteous and helpful, always ready to assist with check-in, luggage, or arranging transport. Service is generally quick, though some guests have found room service slightly delayed during peak hours.

Their in-house restaurant offers a decent variety of food—tasty North Indian dishes and breakfast options are the highlight. While the buffet could use more variety, the quality is satisfying for a short stay.

If you’re looking for a clean, hassle-free stay with airport access, Cygnett Inn delivers on convenience and comfort without burning a hole in your pocket.

I recently stayed at Cygnett Inn Airport and had an absolutely wonderful experience. From the moment I arrived, the hospitality was outstanding. The staff was incredibly welcoming, attentive, and always ready to assist with a smile.

The rooms were modern, spotless, and very comfortable, with all the amenities you could need for a relaxing stay. The bed was cozy, the Wi-Fi was fast, and the overall ambiance of the hotel was peaceful and elegant — perfect for both business and leisure travelers.

The location is ideal, especially for those catching a flight, as it’s very close to the airport yet surprisingly quiet. The hotel's restaurant served a delicious variety of dishes, and the breakfast buffet was a delightful way to start the day with plenty of fresh options.

Special thanks to the front desk and housekeeping teams for making my stay seamless and memorable. Cygnett Inn Airport offers great value for money, and I would highly recommend it to anyone visiting the area. I’m definitely looking forward to returning!

What truly stood out was the hospitality. The staff were polite, responsive, and went out of their way to make sure we had a pleasant stay. Special thanks to the manager for being so accommodating and helpful throughout our visit.

I highly recommend Sheerha Royal Residency to anyone looking for a quality stay near Jaipur Airport. Will definitely return on my next trip!

Treebo The Anchorage in Jaipur is a budget-friendly hotel that stands out primarily for its excellent location, but several shortcomings significantly affect the overall guest experience.

Pros

The most notable advantage of Treebo The Anchorage is its strategic location in Malviya Nagar, close to key landmarks like Jaipur International Airport and Fortis Hospital. Guests consistently appreciate the convenience, with easy access to shopping areas and major roads, making it suitable for both leisure and business travelers. The rooms are generally described as clean, spacious, and equipped with basic amenities, offering good value for the price. Many reviewers have also highlighted the helpfulness and hospitality of the staff, which can enhance the comfort of your stay.

Cons

Despite its strengths, the hotel has several significant drawbacks. Parking is limited, which can be a hassle for those arriving by car—this is a recurring concern among guests.The complimentary breakfast is often criticized for its poor quality, with guests describing it as the "worst breakfast" and noting that the spread is minimal and sometimes unappetizing.The lack of variety and freshness suggests that the complimentary nature of the meal may be affecting standards, and it is an area where Treebo’s administration needs urgent attention.

Another major issue is the inconsistency in toiletries. Only basic bath soap is provided, with no shampoo, moisturizer, or other essentials, which is surprising given that other Treebo properties often offer a more complete set of amenities. This lack of uniformity in standards across the Treebo chain is disappointing and confusing for regular customers. Additionally, maintenance seems to be a recurring problem: bath fittings are sometimes broken or poorly maintained, and there is little effort from the staff to address or update these issues[1]. The in-room tea/coffee maker is frequently reported to be dirty and appears to have been neglected for years, further detracting from the overall comfort and hygiene of the stay.

Conclusion

Treebo The Anchorage offers a great location and decent rooms at an affordable price, but it falls short in several key areas such as parking, breakfast quality, toiletries, and maintenance. These issues, if addressed, could greatly improve the guest experience. Until then, travelers seeking a hassle-free stay with consistent amenities and better upkeep may want to consider alternatives in the area.

I had a fantastic experience at Indie Stays Jaipur! The rooms were impeccably clean, modern, and well-designed, especially the bathroom – it felt luxurious and thoughtfully maintained. The service was top-notch, and the staff was polite, professional, and always ready to help with a smile.

The location is convenient, and everything was smooth from check-in to check-out. At this price point, it’s honestly a hidden gem in Jaipur! Highly recommended for anyone looking for comfort, cleanliness, and quality service. Will definitely visit again! 💯✨

We had a wonderful stay! The service was excellent, and the staff was friendly and attentive throughout. It truly felt like great value for money. Everything was well-maintained and comfortable. Would definitely visit again! Highly recommended.

The stay was extremely pleasant. The property being close to the airport is a major plus point. The rooms and pretty decent. The food they offer is great too. A special shout out to the operations manager Wrik who was so humble, polite and extremely cooperative. He makes sure that the comfort of the guests is his top priority and puts in an extra effort for their comfortable and pleasant stay. Overall a fabulous experience at indie stays.

Amazing room, beautiful location and mainly amazing food!

Great stay!

But while checkout they charged Rs. 1800 per room, quoting that's the price of per room no matter you take for one hour or whole day.

I will strongly suggest to not go there for any family functions as they will not fulfill there promises at last moments but they will talk to you so nicely during booking that you will trust them like they are so good people

I am writing to share my recent experience during my stay at Anjushree Inn from April 30 to May 3, 2025, as I believe it is important to inform others about the challenges I faced.

Upon my arrival at night, I was allocated a room that was not properly cleaned. Dust covered the desks, bed headboard, ceiling fans, air conditioner ducts, and television. I immediately requested a room change, but the receptionist refused, stating that since I booked through Goibibo, I needed to contact them for assistance.

Throughout the night, I discovered that the air conditioner was not functioning. When I brought this to the attention of the receptionist again, he reiterated that a room change was not possible. To make matters worse, I experienced a power outage that made my stay unbearable. The unpleasant smell in the room and the poorly maintained drainage system only added to my discomfort. The staff continued to direct me to Goibibo for any concerns related to my booking, leaving me without support during my stay.

Additionally, I ordered food from the hotel’s restaurant, only to find that many items on the menu were unavailable, but they still charged me the full price. When I requested a bill or invoice, the staff claimed that their printer was not functioning. After persistent insistence, they eventually provided an invoice with incorrect check-in and check-out dates, including a fraudulent GST number. I later received a correct GST invoice after further verification.

Given these numerous inconveniences and the overall lack of professionalism demonstrated by the hotel staff and management, I cannot recommend Anjushree Inn to anyone considering a stay there.

Experience was very bad with this Hotel.. staff was rude. They don't provide breakfast. There restaurent opens at 2 pm. They asked to check out before check out timing.. service was also not good... Because when we entered the room we need to ask to clean the washroom.. they didn't provide us the toilet paper after asking... There was only one staff member who were cleaning the room and washroom and servicing the food in the room.  They don't provide even a single water bottle in the room. They don't change the bedsheet and pillow cover for the next guest.

Hotel Anju Shree Inn is considered a good choice for accommodation. Guests appreciate the comfortable and well-maintained rooms, as well as the clean and inviting environment. The location is usually convenient, with easy access to local attractions and amenities. While some might find the facilities basic compared to higher-end hotels, the overall experience is often seen as satisfactory and good value for money. Overall, Hotel Anju Shree Inn provides a reliable and comfortable stay with attentive service.

One of the worst staff I encountered in  hotel Industry, non cooperative and rude, maybe since the hotel is doing good business hence they don't care about customers. It was my second night in Jaipur and I had to quick fix the room in that area as I had gone to its vicinity for a rajasthani village experience .  Trust me guys , I was skeptical at first as the prices for the rooms are minimal and too good to be true  . It was really good .

Great experience overall, very near to malls and market.  loved the view of area from roof top.  Food quality was genuinely good. Rooms were neat and clean. Stayed between 10th and 11th there.

Hotel Trinay offers a well-rounded, comfortable stay with modern amenities and good location advantages. It seems particularly well-suited for business travelers and families who value convenience and a variety of dining options.

I came to Jaipur on a business trip and initially checked out a few hotels for my stay. However, I wasn’t satisfied with the service at those places. Later, I came across Trinay Hotel, and I must say, it’s an excellent hotel. The service is outstanding, the food is delicious, and it has everything that a good hotel should offer. From my side, I would definitely give Trinay Hotel a 5-star rating.
Every thing is really very well and good. a person working here name somesh he's is really helpful and gentelman guy. Thank you hotel Trinay for made my 3 days wonderful

I had a terrible experience at FabHotel Dream Palace, Jaipur. The condition of the room was absolutely shocking. There were rats inside the room – not just one, but multiple sightings. That itself was enough to ruin the stay. On top of that, the room was full of cigarette smell, and there was dirt everywhere – under the bed, in the corners, even the bathroom was not properly cleaned.

It was obvious that hygiene and cleanliness are not a priority at this place. The bedsheets did not feel fresh, and the entire atmosphere of the room was unhygienic and uncomfortable. Honestly, it did not feel safe or livable, especially if someone is travelling with family or elderly people.

For a hotel that claims to offer decent budget accommodation, this was completely unacceptable. Whether it was poor maintenance or just complete carelessness, the condition of the room was far below basic standards. I checked out early and would strongly advise others to avoid this hotel unless they improve their standards drastically.

The only good thing about my stay was spacious room. Other than that everything else was terrible. While checking in, although I had prepaid for the room, tha staff took a ton of time to verify whether I had paid or not. I opted for complementary breakfast while booking but the staff denied that complementary breakfast is not included in my booking. There was no drinking water in the room. The AC remote didn't work.
Overall a bad experience staying here.

Nestled inside the Treebo Dream Palace hotel in Sanganer, Jaipur, the Dream Restaurant is the on-site casual-dining option serving strictly pure vegetarian North Indian cuisine, with Jain dishes also available  ￼ ￼. It opens for breakfast (8–10 AM), lunch (1–3 PM), and dinner (7–11 PM)  ￼.

✅ Positive Highlights
•	Breakfast spread is complimentary and includes a modest selection of North Indian vegetarian dishes—ideal as a quick start to the day. Many guests found it sufficient, though not lavish  ￼ ￼.
•	Restaurant convenience is a standout: located within the property, it’s helpful after a long journey or for guests who prefer not to venture outside late at night.
•	Several reviews praised the taste of food as “excellent” despite overall budget lodging, especially in relation to value travellers value posture of dining included with stay  ￼.

⚠️ Areas for Improvement
•	The quantity of food—especially during dinner—often felt skimpy for families. One guest described meals as “not enough for one family of two,” asking them to consider better options elsewhere  ￼.
•	Ratings for food quality compiled via MyTrip average at just 3.3/5, lower than location or service scores—suggesting inconsistency or limited choices in menu items  ￼.
•	Cleanliness concerns tied to the overall hotel—such as dusty washrooms or mismanaged room upkeep—sometimes extended to the dining area experience, dampening impressions  ￼.

🧂 Menu Style & Suitability
•	The cuisine remains conservative and north-Indian focused—good for simple meals when you’re weary—but less satisfying for guests craving richer flavours or Rajasthani specialities.
•	Jain food availability is a thoughtful addition for dietary needs.

Me and my friend planned to stay here for a few nights.
Price is quite high for the conditions we received, but we don't want to keep moving around, so we settled here.
We booked one room from two people, but received only one towel, no trash can, no wipe for the shower, and most of all.. not hot water.
The manager claimed that hot water is only available in the morning, (that's not ideal). But to our big surprise, in the morning as well.. no hot water.
That very morning we were told to check out. When we booked, we mentioned we are probably going to stay for longer and we need at least one day notice of a check out, like they need.
It's only fair.. i guess "fair" is not a factor when it comes to more money.

I had a wonderful stay at Hotel Siddarth Palace. The rooms were clean, spacious, and well-maintained, providing a comfortable and relaxing environment. The hotel's location is convenient, with easy access to nearby attractions and amenities.

One of the highlights of my stay was the excellent hospitality provided by the staff. A special mention goes to the manager, who was extremely courteous, attentive.

Had a great stay at The Siddharth Palace! The staff was welcoming, the rooms were clean and comfortable, and the service was top-notch. Loved the food at the in-house restaurant—especially the breakfast spread. The overall ambiance was peaceful and elegant. Highly recommend for both business and leisure stays!

1/5 Stars - Avoid This Hotel at All Costs

My one-night stay was a nightmare. The hotel was filthy, with torn bed linen that wasn't washed despite multiple uses. The washroom was disgustingly dirty, and dust coated every surface in the room. The AC malfunctioned, and stained chairs added to the misery.

The staff seemed disorganized, and the online pictures were misleading, showcasing a newly constructed building that no longer reflects the current state.

Despite paying a premium, basic amenities like soap and toothpaste were missing. The included breakfast was unthinkable due to the hotel's unhygienic conditions.

Given the poor experience, I suspect the positive reviews might be fake or paid. Unless they revamp entirely, I'd advise potential guests to look elsewhere. Not worth the money.

I had a wonderful stay at siddharth hotel.The staff was incredibly friendly and accommodating, the room was clean and comfortable, and the amenities exceeded my expectations. I especially appreciated the person name Vishnu was working there the hospitality provided was good . I will definitely be returning and recommending your hotel to others. Thank you for a fantastic experience

Great location, beautiful surrounding atmosphere, great staff. Most friendly and helpful receptionist and staff ever, lovely and great first impression of hotel. Food was good and great value for money and service was attentive and efficient. Room itself was well equipped and comfortable. I was very pleased with my stay. I hope to be back for a longer visit in the future.

I recently stayed at the Aravali Inn Hotel, and I had a wonderful experience. The staff was extremely welcoming and accommodating, and the room was clean and comfortable. The hotel's location was convenient, with easy access to nearby attractions. The on-site restaurant served delicious food, and the overall atmosphere was pleasant. Absolutely amazing experience! The hosts at Michael's Homestay were warm and welcoming, making us feel right at home. The rooms were spotless, cozy, and well-equipped. We especially loved the peaceful vibe, the delicious breakfast each morning, and the convenience of being so close to the airport. Highly recommended for anyone visiting Jaipur!

Staying at Michael's Homestay was an experience that went beyond just comfort—it was a journey into warmth, culture, and genuine hospitality. Owned by a cultured and educated family with a deep love for plants and gardens, every corner of this homestay reflects their passion and care. The rooms were impeccably neat and clean, offering a perfect blend of simplicity and comfort.

What truly set this place apart was the heartfelt service that radiated a noble approach, making me feel the deeper value of life. Mornings were a true delight, especially during breakfast on the terrace, where a beautifully curated garden breathed life into the day. Surrounded by vibrant greenery, the fresh air and serene ambiance filled me with pure joy and set a positive tone for the rest of the day.

Michael's Homestay isn’t just a place to stay—it’s a haven where hospitality blossoms as naturally as their garden, leaving you refreshed, inspired, and truly happy.

Wonderful Family Stay!

We had a fantastic stay at Michael's with our family, including our infant. The hosts were incredibly welcoming and attentive, making sure we had everything we needed for a comfortable stay. The rooms were spacious, clean, and perfect for our family. We especially appreciated the thoughtful touches that made traveling with a little one so much easier. Special thanks to Aunty who cooks the tastiest food. The location was also great, offering both tranquility and easy access to nearby attractions. Highly recommend this homestay for anyone looking for a cozy, family-friendly getaway.

There are so many beautiful plants around the place and a great view from the terrace. The hosts are extremely kind and welcoming, and have great knowledge of what to see and where to go in the local area. Highly recommend Michael's Home-stay.

Worst Experience at Hotel FlyView – Highly Unprofessional and Rude Staff!

I had booked Hotel FlyView through FabHotels, and my experience was absolutely horrible. I reached the hotel at 7 AM, and the receptionist straight away told me "no room is available" in a very rude tone. When I said I was informed that check-in is possible till 12 PM, he bluntly refused and told me "bhago yaha se" — can you imagine this level of misbehavior at a hotel?

The receptionist was extremely arrogant, didn’t listen to anything, and behaved as if I was at fault for showing up. After this shocking behavior, I contacted FabHotels customer care hoping for support, but it got even worse. They kept me on hold for 20 minutes — not once, but four times! Still, no proper help was provided.

I was left stranded, stressed, and completely helpless.
This is by far the worst hospitality experience I’ve ever had. I strongly advise others to avoid booking Hotel FlyView via FabHotels — neither the staff nor the company cares about their guests.

Terrible Experience at Hotel FlyView – Never Booking with FabHotels Again!

I visited Hotel FlyView on Sunday, after making a booking directly through FabHotels customer care. I expected a smooth check-in experience, but what I faced was shocking and highly disappointing.

I reached the hotel at 7 AM, and the receptionist rudely denied my booking, saying there were no rooms available. When I told him that the customer care team confirmed my booking and check-in time, he ignored everything I said and shouted at me to leave the premises. His exact words were, "Bhago yaha se." I’ve never seen such rude behavior from hotel staff before.

Thinking FabHotels would help, I called their customer care again, but instead of resolving my issue, they just put me on hold for 20 minutes — four times in a row! There was no real assistance or empathy from their side. I was left completely helpless and frustrated.

This whole experience ruined my day. If you value your time, money, and dignity, avoid Hotel FlyView and avoid booking through FabHotels. Their service and support are pathetic.

I stayed with Nadya and Yusuf for one month and it was perfect. I shared the room with my friend and we loved it. Nadya is such a wonderful chef, we ate almost everyday with them because the food was just delicious!! We enjoyed all the meals and Nadya was so kind that she also asked if we wanted any special dish.

Yusuf, her husband, was always there to serve the food and have very interesting conversations. He knows a lot about the city and every kind of tourist recommendation.

We will miss Nadya Homestay for sure, thanks a lot guys for making us feel at home 🌞

A True Home Away From Home

We stayed at Nadya Homestay for two months, and it was an unforgettable experience. My colleague and I—both journalists—were working with Nadya’s husband, Yusuf, a renowned anthropologist specializing in nomadic tribes. From the moment we arrived, Nadya and Yusuf made us feel completely at home.

Nadya is an incredible chef. I used to think vegetarian food was boring until I tasted her cooking. She always buys fresh vegetables and meat and prepares amazing, homemade meals, with freshly made roti bread. She even shared some of her traditional Indian recipes with us.

Yusuf knows Jaipur city very well. He was always there to help us with anything we needed, from information about the city to recommendations for cheap souvenir shops, local activities, and hidden gems (literally we bought emeralds).

The homestay itself is perfect if you’re looking for comfort and warmth. The house is very clean, and they have both AC and heating, ensuring a pleasant stay with hot showers year-round. The rooftop is a wonderful space for morning workouts or peaceful meditation sessions.

Nadya Homestay truly reflects one of the most beautiful aspects of Indian culture: the value of family. It is a peaceful, welcoming, and comfortable place to stay, and it quickly became our home away from home.

We highly recommend Nadya Homestay and can’t wait to visit again!

A really cute room and a nice place to have a quiet stay in the busy Jaipur. Nadya and Yusuf are really kind hosts!
+ Amazing shower, we could do our laundry!
-far out of the city (good bus connection takes 50min to Ajmer Gate), even though breakfast was good, it was not included in the price and a bit expensive…

Lovely people and a great experience. Nadya and Yussef are kind and helpful - staying at their place is a perfect introduction to what life is truly like in India - not the version you’ll see at an expensive hotel. The room is basic but is clean and comfortable, and Nadya is a great cook. They also make excellent recommendations.

*1/5 - Disappointing Stay at Hotel Holiday Home, Jaipur*

I recently had the misfortune of staying at Hotel Holiday Home in Jaipur, and my experience was extremely disappointing. The hotel failed to provide even basic amenities and cleanliness.

*Major Issues:*

- Unclean rooms and common areas
- Non-functional flush in the toilet
- No locks on bathroom doors
- Dirty bed sheets
- Outdated, poorly maintained rooms
- Subpar service from staff

*Unacceptable Experience:*

For a hotel claiming to provide comfortable accommodations, Holiday Home fell woefully short. The lack of attention to cleanliness and maintenance made my stay unpleasant. The service was unresponsive and unhelpful.

*Travelers Beware:*

If you value your comfort and hygiene, I would strongly advise against staying at Hotel Holiday Home, Jaipur. There are far better options available in the city.

*Rating Breakdown:*

- Cleanliness: 1/5
- Maintenance: 1/5
- Service: 1.5/5
- Value for Money: 1/5

*Recommendation:*

Hotel management, please take immediate action to address these issues and improve your services.

Hotel Metro Regency, Jaipur – A Safe & Comfortable Stay for Female Travelers

During our recent trip to Jaipur, we stayed at Hotel Metro Regency, and we couldn’t be happier with our experience. As female travelers, safety and comfort were our top priorities, and this hotel exceeded our expectations in every way.

Location & Accessibility

The hotel is conveniently located in the heart of Jaipur, making it easy to explore major attractions like Hawa Mahal, City Palace, and Johri Bazaar. Public transport and cab services are easily available, which made our sightseeing hassle-free.

Hospitality & Service

From the moment we checked in, the hotel staff made us feel extremely welcome. The check-in process was smooth, and the reception staff was friendly and accommodating. They ensured that we had all the necessary information about the hotel’s facilities and even offered assistance with local travel tips.

The housekeeping and room service teams were prompt and efficient. The hotel staff showed great professionalism, which made us feel secure and valued as guests.

Rooms & Cleanliness

The rooms were spacious, clean, and well-maintained. The bedding was fresh, and the room had all essential amenities like air conditioning, a TV, and complimentary WiFi. The washrooms were spotless, with 24-hour hot water availability. We truly appreciated the attention to hygiene and cleanliness.

Food & Dining

The hotel offers an in-house restaurant with a variety of dishes, and the food quality was excellent. The breakfast was delicious and had a good mix of Indian and continental options. The staff was courteous and ensured that our dining experience was pleasant.

Safety & Comfort for Female Travelers

One of the best aspects of Hotel Metro Regency is how safe and secure it felt for female travelers. The hotel has round-the-clock security, and the staff was respectful and attentive, ensuring that we felt comfortable throughout our stay.

Overall Experience

Our stay at Hotel Metro Regency was delightful, and we highly recommend it to female travelers, families, and anyone looking for a comfortable stay in Jaipur. The excellent hospitality, cleanliness, and security make it a great choice for tourists.

Rating: ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ (5/5)
Would definitely stay here again on our next visit to Jaipur!

I visited this hotel with family from 24 March to 25 March . I was on personal visit from Mumbai to mehandipur balaji temple. I am writing this review not because the people at the hotel did any favor to me but to help people to choose a right hotel to stay to make their trip comfortable and memorable. I booked room no 119 for two days from 11.03.25 to 12.03.25. Here is the detailed review -

1. The room and the bathroom were clean and well maintained. The room was well lit and ventilation of the room is really good. Pillow, bed sheet and every material provided in the room was clean and hygienic. The smart TV in the room works.

2. It is just 2 mins walk from the Jaipur station and only 100 mts to be specific. The room was not noisy.

3. It is just opposite to the police station and therefore you don't need to think about safety.

4. The railway station, metro station, bus stand all are in walking distance. All the necessary shops are nearby.

5. The hotel is running a restaurant for the guests. The food is tasty and price is reasonable. The same quality food will cost much outside. The sitting place of the restaurant is clean and spacious. The reception is also very spacious.

6. The best part of this hotel is the people running it. Two elderly people and one mid aged man (probably Sureshji) was in the reception in different time. All are very welcoming and helpful. The attendant and cook Ramraj bhai is very polite.

The atmosphere of the hotel is calm and it runs without any chaos. We traveled Rajasthan for 12 days and stayed in different budget hotels. Staying in this hotel was our best experience. People traveling with family will love this place.

N.B. The rooms you see in the picture look exactly like that. This is probably a new property. If you are in jaipur, and searching for a comfortable stay, go for it.

Overall, it’s an excellent choice for a comfortable and convenient stay.

We recently booked a stay at this property through OYO, having prepaid based on the appealing photos online. Unfortunately, the reality was far from the expectations set by the images. Here's our experience:

No Parking Facility: Upon arrival with my family, we discovered there was no parking available. This was the first inconvenience, setting the tone for what followed.

Check-in Before Room Inspection: The staff took our IDs and checked us in without showing us the rooms. When we were finally shown the rooms, they were in an appalling state.

Unhygienic Rooms: The first two rooms presented were filthy. The bedsheets had visible stains and liquids, the washrooms were dirty, and there was a strong, unpleasant odor. Upon complaining, we were shown two more rooms, which were no better.

Documented Neglect: We took photos as evidence of the horrifying conditions—broken toilet seats, cigarette butts in supposedly "cleaned" rooms, a pervasive irritating smell, spit marks on the mirror, dirty bed corners, torn towels, overused bedsheets, and broken electrical outlets. The overall environment was unsanitary and unsafe.

OYO Customer Care Fails Customers: When we decided not to stay in this uninhabitable hotel and reported the issues to OYO support, we were extremely disappointed. Instead of addressing our concerns, the customer care executive prioritized the hotel manager’s claims over the photo proof we submitted. They even claimed the manager was “willing to help” when this was not the case.

No Refund Despite Non-Stay: Despite the conditions and proof of neglect, OYO refused to issue a refund for a stay we didn’t even take. We ultimately drove 350 km back home with a 2-year-old child after a tiring day of travel, as staying in such an unsafe and hazardous property was not an option.

Privacy and Security Breach: After the call with OYO customer care was disconnected, the property manager directly called my wife's personal number, which had been used during booking. This was highly unprofessional and a serious breach of privacy. How does OYO ensure the safety and security of its customers in such cases?

Overall, this experience has left us deeply dissatisfied with both the hotel and OYO’s service. The lack of accountability, the poor customer care response, and the failure to address our concerns raise serious questions about OYO's commitment to providing a safe and pleasant stay for its customers.

We strongly urge OYO to reconsider its policies, take strict action against such properties, and improve its customer support system. For now, this will remain one of our worst travel experiences.

I will surely escalate this matter to OYO leadership to determine what comes next.

Dear Fellow Travelers,

I want to bring to your attention a concerning issue I have observed with one of the hotels listed on the OYO platform. It seems this hotel is involved in malpractice, such as manipulating reviews and surveys through fake and misleading feedback.

Before booking, I strongly encourage you to take a close look at the reviews for this property, especially the five-star ones. Most of them are from accounts like "Rahull," "Kuldeep," "Sanjay," etc., with random pictures or irrelevant text. Some even mention amenities like bouquets, pools, or gyms that don’t exist at the hotel, clearly indicating they are copied or fabricated.

The OYO algorithm seems to automatically prioritize five-star reviews, which pushes genuine feedback further down. This can easily fool real customers like us. Additionally, there are signs that some bookings marked as “pay later” are being falsely flagged as paid by hotel staff to boost the ratings.

Is it even legal to manipulate reviews and mislead customers like this? Such practices not only deceive potential guests but also harm the credibility of platforms like OYO.

I am posting this here to warn others in case OYO management overlooks this issue. Please do your due diligence and thoroughly check reviews before booking any property.

Stay vigilant and book wisely!
